# Blazor for Web Forms Developers

> Migrating ASP.NET Web Forms applications to Blazor. Covers component-based architecture, data binding, forms and validation, routing, and JavaScript interop. Blazor enables C# code to run in the browser via WebAssembly or on the server with SignalR.

- [App startup](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/app-startup.md): Learn how to define the startup logic for your app.
- [Architecture comparison of ASP.NET Web Forms and Blazor](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/architecture-comparison.md): Learn how the architectures of ASP.NET Web Forms and Blazor compare.
- [Build reusable UI components with Blazor](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/components.md): Learn how to build reusable UI components with Blazor and how they compare to ASP.NET Web Forms controls.
- [App configuration](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/config.md): Learn how to configure Blazor apps without using ConfigurationManager.
- [Data access and management](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/data.md): Learn how to access and handle data in ASP.NET Web Forms and Blazor.
- [Forms and validation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/forms-validation.md): Learn how to build forms with client-side validation in Blazor.
- [Blazor app hosting models](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/hosting-models.md): Learn the different ways to host a Blazor app, including in the browser on WebAssembly or on the server.
- [Blazor for ASP.NET Web Forms Developers](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/index.md): Learn how to build full-stack web apps with .NET using Blazor and .NET Core in a simple and familiar way.
- [An introduction to Blazor for ASP.NET Web Forms developers](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/introduction.md): An introduction to Blazor and writing full-stack web apps with .NET
- [Modules, handlers, and middleware](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/middleware.md): Learn about handling HTTP requests with modules, handlers, and middleware.
- [Migrate from ASP.NET Web Forms to Blazor](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/migration.md): Learn how to approach migrating an existing ASP.NET Web Forms app to Blazor.
- [Pages, routing, and layouts](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/pages-routing-layouts.md): Learn how to create pages in Blazor, work with client-side routing, and manage page layouts.
- [Project structure for Blazor apps](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/project-structure.md): Learn how the project structures of ASP.NET Web Forms and Blazor projects compare.
- ['Security: authentication and authorization in ASP.NET Web Forms and Blazor'](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/security-authentication-authorization.md): Learn how to handle authentication and authorization in ASP.NET Web Forms and Blazor.
- [State management](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/architecture/blazor-for-web-forms-developers/state-management.md): Learn different approaches for managing state in ASP.NET Web Forms and Blazor.
